scenario 1.background: After a yoga class, Noah notices that Larry seems more stressed than usual. Recalling that Larry recently went through a divorce, Noah believes that Larry might be facing financial difficulties as a result.

dialogue.Noah: Hey Larry, tough class today, huh? I've noticed you seemed a bit preoccupied lately. Everything alright?
dialogue.Larry: Yeah, it's been a rough few months with the divorce and all. Just trying to keep everything together.

dialogue.Noah: I can only imagine how hard it must be. If you ever need someone to talk to about the legal side of things, I’m here. Maybe I can offer some informal advice?
dialogue.Larry: I appreciate that, Noah. I might actually take you up on that offer. It’s been overwhelming.

scenario 2.background: Noah feels anxious about bringing up financial issues directly, fearing it might embarrass Larry. He decides to start with a general discussion during their next meet-up at a coffee shop.

dialogue.Noah: Have you been following these crazy economic trends lately? The market’s been all over the place.
dialogue.Larry: I have, it’s been hard to make any financial plans with everything so unstable.

dialogue.Noah: It’s definitely a tricky time for planning. Speaking of which, how have you been managing financially? I know it can be tough during transitions like a divorce.
dialogue.Larry: It’s been difficult, honestly. I’m not sure I’m doing the right things financially.

scenario 3.background: Encouraged by Larry’s openness during their previous conversation, Noah decides to offer more specific advice on managing the legal aspects of Larry’s divorce.

dialogue.Noah: I’m glad you opened up last time we talked. If you’re up for it, I can share some insights on how to handle the legal stuff with your divorce that might help.
dialogue.Larry: That would be great, Noah. I really need guidance on that.

dialogue.Noah: One thing you might consider is how you manage the joint accounts and credit lines. It’s important to get those sorted out as cleanly as possible.
dialogue.Larry: I hadn’t thought about that. I’ll need to look into it. Thanks for the tip.

scenario 4.background: After providing some detailed advice, Noah notices that Larry seems overwhelmed. Feeling concerned, Noah decides to address this and reassure him during their next yoga class.

dialogue.Noah: Larry, I hope I didn’t overwhelm you last time with all that legal advice. I just want to help, not make things harder for you.
dialogue.Larry: It was a lot to take in, but I’m really grateful, Noah. It’s just a lot to process right now.

dialogue.Noah: I understand. Just know I’m here for you, and we can tackle this step by step, at your pace.
dialogue.Larry: Thanks, man. That means a lot. I might need to go over some things again with you.

scenario 5.background: Feeling relieved that Larry appreciates his support, Noah wants to ensure his advice is useful and plans to continue his support. They meet again at the yoga studio to discuss future steps.

dialogue.Noah: I’m glad you found our talks helpful, Larry. I want to make sure I’m supporting you in the best way. Any feedback or particular areas you want to focus on next?
dialogue.Larry: Honestly, your advice has been invaluable. Maybe we can keep focusing on the financial aspects for now?

dialogue.Noah: Absolutely, we can do that. Let’s set up a time to go through everything in detail and make a solid plan.
dialogue.Larry: Sounds good. I really appreciate this, Noah. Thanks for sticking by me.
